topic.title: Defining list values in test scenarios

body.p: When data types in Decision Model and Notation (DMN) models are configured as List types, you can set the values of the list for that data object in the corresponding test scenario. You can define list values in cells for both GIVEN and EXPECT columns.

ol.li: In your VSCode IDE, open the DMN file that contains the decisions that you want to test and select the Data Types tab to view the data types for that DMN model.

li.p: Add or modify a data type of any kind, toggle the List option to define the data type as a list, and save the DMN file.

div.p: For example, the following State data type is part of a DMN model for determining fine amounts and driver suspension in a traffic violation decision service. In this case, the State data type is defined as a List type so that the relevant states can be explicitly listed in the decision service or test scenarios.

fig.title: Example State data type as a list

image.alt: Image of State data type as a list type

li.p: Add or modify a test scenario (.scesim) file that corresponds to the DMN decision service and insert the DMN data type that you defined as a List type in a relevant GIVEN or EXPECT header cell.

div.p: For example, the following TrafficViolationTest.scesim test scenario file uses the Driver â†’ State data object defined previously as a List type as part of the GIVEN parameters for the traffic violation scenarios.

fig.title: Example State data type in a test scenario header cell

image.alt: Image of State data type as a list type in test scenario

li.p: Double-click a value cell in the column and in the window that appears, select from the following options:

ul.li: Create List: Use this option to create a list using the guided form in the window. Select Add list value to begin adding list values.
Define List: Use this option to define a list as a Friendly Enough Expression Language (FEEL) literal expression.

image.alt: Image of window to create list
Image of window to add list values
Image of window to define list as FEEL expression

li.p: Click Save in the list window to save the list values.

div.p: The value for the selected cell in the test scenario is now defined with the new list:

fig.title: Example list for State cell value

image.alt: Image of State column with new list value
